Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ptitp
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family with 2 young children and got an excellent offer for 2 joining double rooms at 550 AED. I noticed that the appliances and fittings were originally of high standards and of all good brand names. Unfortunately, it looks like those standards were not kept through time. The repair works look approximate, the bedsheets and towels are old and brand name tiles are matched by a plastic-like sink in the bathroom. Overall, a good initial effort but no proper follow up. Too bad.... Still, the rooms are clean, comfy and quiet. The restaurant (the middle estern one) was empty for dinner but the food was very good. The staff was of mixed quality, but generally not properly trained (No greetings, no smile, a million questions they already had the answer to...). But that is pretty standard around here even for a 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent hotel”
Reviews.Author: StoychevV
Reviews.Content: Hi, my name is Vassil Stoychev and this was my first, but not last trip to Dubai. About the hotel: it is just a great hotel ith friendly staff and clean, big rooms. Breakfast was fine to me and my family. And, yes, there is no free wi-fi. But they have a free shuttle to "Deira centre" and the subway is about 500m away. In other words- it is an excelent family hotel.

Reviews.Title: “coral deira sept 2009”
Reviews.Author: hafsa s
Reviews.Content: My husband, one year old son and I stayed at Coral Deira in Sept 2009. We had a good stay and the hotel is well located and very clean. a very good family hotel that is alcohol free. The staff in the cafe sownstairs were very friendly and would often come up and take my sons bottle to fill it with warm milk whenever we were going out.

Reviews.Title: “good but NOT 4 star”
Reviews.Author: kukuriku
Reviews.Content: Good but not 4 star, had only breakfast there but wasn't impressed. One thing I do mind is the poor Internet access. Booking through an agency doesn't include free WI-FI connection. The computer in the ''business centre'' is not well ''equiped''

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: VP78
Reviews.Content: nice hotel located in the deira city, all closeby locations, good food., the hotel is clean, good staff, malls closeby, well connected to burdubai nd sharjah, airport closeby. njoyed stay.would like to visit again, its value for money

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money, decent location”
Reviews.Author: FMD88528
Reviews.Content: Coral Deira Dubai is probably a '3.7 star' hotel (it is listed as a 4-star). It has decent, clean rooms and T/B and a regular, albeit limited breakfast buffet selection. Its location is good (walking distance to Al Ghurair, except during the summer) and a 10 AED taxi ride to CityCenter Mall. At any rate, there are cabs available any time during the day and the staff are always willing to help. I stay here almost every time during my quarterly business trips to the Middle East because it is the best value I can find in Dubai. I get free internet access too. Overall, I am very satisfied with Coral Deira Dubai. Given my frequency of stay, it would have been more satisfying if the hotel offered a loyalty program to reward me of my preference.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money...end of”
Reviews.Author: solomon n
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, well located and has the basic services one would need while on holidaym My family and I all enjoyed the rooming facilities,food and general professionalism of the staff. The only issue we had is they had promised airport transfers and then did not hold up their end of the bargain. They were actually very unhelpful in finding us other means to get to and from the airport. But all in all apart from that debacle of not picking and dropping us off we would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Ras al Khaima, Ras Al Khaimah, United Arab Emirates
Reviews.Title: “a one night stay :)”
Reviews.Author: Arjay C
Reviews.Content: it was just a one night stay just arrived from airport. We are checked in as normal, however I dont feel welcomed. After the check in, I even asked the guy if thats all and just said yes. On the other hand the concierge service isvery good. The food was great. and the rest were all fine.

Reviews.Title: “5 star all the way sir”
Reviews.Author: bernard r
Reviews.Content: The hotel ranked high on our list ,was recomended on trip advisor review channels and we got the best of the breed i guess for our stay ,an unreal deal over the internet and a great stay ,short but no complaints ,will be back at this great hotel with an awesome quiet all around and a lovely mid deck swimming pool .

Reviews.Title: “Very good family one”
Reviews.Author: nadiaJordan
Reviews.Content: We are staying in this hotel since one year & half ... Very very clean one .... Amazing breakfast , you get confused what to eat from ow rich it's ... Family hotel .... Near the airport ... Near a metro station ... Try it ... You will not regret as it's great value of money too ....

Reviews.Title: “5* in hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Plebeya
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my husband for 3 nights. It´s located in the old part of the city, which doesn´t make the sorrounding very appealing, but they offer a free shuttle to Deira City Center. Once there, you can take the metro to any of the other malls (both Dubai Mall or Mall of the Emirates) YOU CAN´T GET LOST, trust me! There´s only one metro line (the red one) and it connects the most famous attractions. Of course, you can also hire a taxi cab. They are very affordable. This is the only down side I find in this hotel. Besides that, I have nothing bad to say about it. Everyone is so kind, speacilly the philippine waitress, that I really felt sorry I had to leave. One last tip: There´s air conditioning in practically EVERYWHERE, so be prepared for the impact of a difference of temperatures.

Reviews.Title: “Think I will stick to this place..”
Reviews.Author: anishjosie
Reviews.Content: We are back from our weekend getaway at Coral Diera...The stay was very nice, very cozy. We had a tiring experience after the 2 hr long Visa process at Terminal 2... Although the Hotel is right in the city besides d main road.. It was very quite inside the room, although our room was facing the road at the first floor. Breakfast was continental and the staffs took very good care of us. Kishore our host at the hotel was very kind and offered to give us some Indian dishes other than the buffet... We hadn't time for any sauna or swimming may be next time. Our host at the dinner was a fellow mallu, who gave us some special considerations.... Just a small issue was that they didnt give me a extra bed..when i asked for my kids.. Maybe becoz of the plan I took with the travel agent or maybe it was late abt 12 in the night.. My younger boy was comfortable on the couch so it didnt matter much. Over all experience in the hotel was nice.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING STAY”
Reviews.Author: Radi786
Reviews.Content: It was my first time to stay at coral deira hotel and it was unforgettable stay, the staff are really very helpful, rooms are very spacious and up to the standard of 4**** Hotel and the food is very delicious. I will most definitely stay again in coral deira.

Reviews.Title: “Recommendable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: meetthebigj
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in Jan 2011. The rooms were very clean and good, but extremely small. The breakfast was not good. The internet is very expensive. They charge 80 AED per day or 25AED per hour, which is ridiculous by all stardards. Even the speed is only average. Other than these few glitches, the hotel is good. I was on a very busy business trip, so was returning late at night just to sleep. Its a liquor free hotel and if have any friends visiting you, you have to give 1000 explanations to take them to your room. There is a grocery store nearby, where you get almost all necessities. If you walk a little further (around 400 mtrs) you have a huge choice of various restuarents and cafes in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: PoojaG1
Reviews.Content: The staff is really helpful. The hotel rooms are clean and big. The breakfast was good. They didnt have much vegetarian one of the days and the chef was nice enough to cook up something for us right then.

Reviews.Title: “If this hotel was a colour, it would be beige.”
Reviews.Author: Wozza2404
Reviews.Content: I've never stayed in a hotel that was best defined by the word "average" before, but now I have. There's nothing wrong with the hotel, it's perectly fine, it's adequate, it does the job. But the fact is that for the same money you can stay in a better hotel that isn't in Deira (not the greatest of areas). It is close to the airport, though. The food was OK, but I don't remember it being particularly memorable. The staff we instantly forgetable. Apart from the taxi driver who loiters outside the hotel and tries to get you into his "hotel cab" which is unmetered and will cost you double (not a big deal, as it's still only a couple of quid), but just f*** him off and flag down a proper taxi. Fine for a night, but I'll probably stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Coral Deira Hotel Dubai An Oasis of Luxury at affordable prices”
Reviews.Author: RGS1000 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel to Australia each year, and make Dubai a first stopover, staying at the Coral Deira. This hotel has evolved into our home when in Dubai, such is the warm welcome we always receive from the Staff, commencing with a car transfer from the airport to the hotel which takes less than 10 minutes. The Club Select Rooms are tastefully furnished with solid wood furniture, and the en-suite facilities are most comprehensive. The King size beds are very comfortable indeed and the tea and coffee making facilities provided in the room are accompanied by complimentary water bottles. The LCD television is of a good size and Sky News is offered amongst the many channels available. My recommendation would be to purchase a bed and breakfast package, since the breakfasts provided will delight even the most discerning palate. There is a Business Centre located in the lobby to provide an hour of free Internet access per day for e-mail use etc, and the opportunity to check in on-line with your airline is very convenient indeed. The restaurants within the hotel provide a varied menu of classical arabic food and Italian cuisine, in a very relaxed atmosphere of quiet comfort. It is a non-alcoholic hotel however this proves to be quite acceptable since the alternative drinks offered are wide and varied. I cannot praise the Coral Deira hotel highly enough for the mnanner with which every guest is treated as a friend and afforded every consideration. During our recent stay, we just missed the complimentary bus service to the shopping Mall at Deira City, and they arranged for us to travel with the General Manager into the City area in his limousine, as he was to attend a business meeting close by. This is the landmark indicator of the extent of cordiallity offered at Coral Deira Hotel Dubai, and once you have stayed there, you will want to return.

Reviews.Title: “BRILLIANT BRILLIANT BRILLIANT!!”
Reviews.Author: kimbo316
Reviews.Content: Best hotel I have ever stayed in! Such a modernised hotel! The swimming pool and jazuzzi on the roof are amazing! There is also a gym aswell! Great location, not too far from airport or the Gold souk! If you are going to Dubai, stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “good rooms, great food.”
Reviews.Author: holyyshek
Reviews.Content: Coral Deira is a very good hotel in Deira Dubai. The rooms are very nice and have great interiors.It was very difficult for me to leave the the room as every thing was so indulging. The staff is also very friendly(something not very common in dubai). The food was something to die for.. It was perfect for my palet. The issue I have about this hotel is that the rules are not flexible as we had to wait for an hour in the lobby as we came before check in time. I would recomend this hotel to other travelers

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ZEE30
Reviews.Content: This is a 5* hotel which is great for families. It is situated near the metro and as it serves no alcohol is set apart from Deira city centre there will be no troublesome noisy neighbours through the night. although we had a little trouble with housekeeping (kept forgetting our towels) the front of house staff were very friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay”
Reviews.Author: NoraK2
Reviews.Content: Nice room and friendly staff. Book early if you want airport pick up.

Reviews.Title: “Totally alright and I would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Trasp
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel 4-5 times in the past 2,5 years, have stayed there for 1, 2 and 4 weeks and I have to say that I'm quite happy with it and would try booking it for my next trip to Dubai as well. I'm really not sure where all those negative revies are coming from I've had ONLY 2 unpleasant occasions: 1. First time they were supposed to pick me up from the airport but it tokk me forever to go thought passport control so there was noone at the airport arrivals waiting for me. I called the hotel and they told me to take any taxi and they'll pay the bill, which they really did. 2. Some other time I arranged (free) transfer back to the aiport with them but it was some odd time in the middle of the night for a red-eye flight so when I checked out there was no transportation waiting. However, the receptionist solved it and 15min later I had my transfer. Well, 2 other slight negative is that they have one very serious-faced waitress (hostess?) in the breakfast restaurant. I think she could act a bit more friendly. Then they also have one rather annoying doorman who grabs your bag from your hands every single time you show up at the entrance, even if they are so small that there is obviously no need for help. A tip beggar, really, kind of annoying. I NEVER had any problems witch check-in or booking or them ignoring my e-mails, quite the opposite: I need visa to enter Dubai (arranged by the hotel) and sometimes my requests are very confusing and changing: my travel dates change, or are pending, or my required visa type changes, or I need to split/combine the bookings.. So, every single time the reply very fast, with all the info I'm asking, with great willigness to jump through all the hoops with all my messy requests, making sure someone else picks up my case immediately if the initial person goes on holiday etc, their "visa manager" always deals with me personally, in e-mails and in person, there's always a cold welcome drink upon arrival etc. Moreover, they are flexible with my check-out times (check out at 9pm with no extra charge), always fresh flowers in my room (with some hotel chocolates and flower petals on my bed), always complimentary bottle of water (not just the first one). Another time they picked up my additional visa charge (charged by coressponding government authorities) despite the screw-up that caused the charge was from my side AND still gave me late check out option at no extra charge... Anyways, my rooms are always decent size, clean, comfortable and well equipped, the staff is very nice and helpful (except for that one serious waitress and that one beggar doorman)... Someone complained about no iron in the room, no alcohol in the hotel and about construction/ugly view. Well, it is Dubai, you know. Meaning, construction everywhere and absence of alcohol - is NORMAL for that city. Sure, there are are hotels with lovely views and/or no construction nearby but those would be in a different price category. Given reality of Dubai as whole Coral Deira has TOTALLY NORMAL price/value ratio. As for the iron, once again - it's Dubai. "Outsourcing" that sort of work is so affordable and widely spread here that noone would imagine that a 4*-5* hotel guest would even consider doing it himself. Location - close to the airport, a couple of decent malls and a handful of nice restaurants. I agree that it's not in the best spot for visiting the main attractions of contemporary Dubai, all the westernized, brand new skyscrapers and all that jazz. But if you want to get a feel of more "real" Dubai, more authentic - and delicious and cheap! -restaurants - then the location is excellent. I'm happy with the hotel and the price, would recommend it and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK”
Reviews.Author: Visitor-UK
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in Al Muraqabat Street, a pleasant tree lined street with selection of shops, cafes, and a big local supermarket. Two average malls within walking distance and, if you can cope with the traffic - the creek! Hotel provide a free bus to beach, Deira shopping centre and paid trip to airport. Not well located for the main visitor sites in Dubai. The hotel is nice from outside - sort of Art deco, the grim photos from previous visitor are because there is a new building on the right, the rest of the hotel is fine, although the area around is a bit of a building site. Nice lobby, meals on first floor. Room was OK, good sized bathroom, with safe, free tea & coffee, free water (only on first day!), mini bar, well stocked with the usual overpriced goodies, internet access expensive ( why hotels charge when its free at the airport is beyond me) Roof top pool is not 'minging', its small, with fresh towels, iced water, and is very pleasant. Food was buffet and perfectly OK with wide choice of hot & cold meals. However they seem, as mentioned by others, to be unable to cope with e mails! Arriving at 4 am I just wanted to confirm taxi, no reply. The flight arrived 40 minutes early - no taxi, so they hadn't bothered to check flight arrivals. Worth it? Well with hundreds of other hotels on Trip Advisor, only if you get a good deal on the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel but overcharged on check-in”
Reviews.Author: jhaddy_the_great
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel directly through the hotels website and got a good deal but when we turned up they quoted us a different price saying the exchange rate was different. Later after I worked out the price I realised I had been overcharged considerably. Top tip, just keep several reciepts when booking, one for you and one for the hotel and insist on paying the quoted price. Apart from that, the hotel was excellent, staff were helpful and can arrange most day trips/excursions. The rooms are excellent and clean. They have a rooftop pool which we didn't use but looked nice. Only other downpoint is the location, being a taxi ride from most places. It is also EXTREMELY difficult to get a taxi outside the hotel, the few that pass by don't want to stop and walking to the nearby shopping mall doesn't help either and people will jump in your taxi that you've been waiting for. On several occasions we waited for over an hour for a taxi. The hotel did offer a taxi but wanted double what is should of been. My tip would be to walk down towards the creek where taxis seem more willing to stop for you. Don't let this put you off, this is an excellent hotel, just stick to the price quoted and don't get too wound up about the taxis. One more plus point, Spice Island at the rennaisance hotel is within walking distance if you know where your going.

Reviews.Title: “2 star at very best”
Reviews.Author: devs4858
Reviews.Content: this hotel is shocking!! dont stay there. it is never a 5 star! rooms are dirty, ugly and in middle of nowhere! breakfast was awful and pool is just minging. worst hotel in dubai by far!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced !!!!”
Reviews.Author: ajpSouthAfrica
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel for 1 night with my father - what a dive !!! See attached pics of our "view" from our minature rooms - the smallest room I have ever stayed in ... more like a 2 star pension than a 4 star hotel... also could not even get a beer as it is an alcohol free hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: Max786
Reviews.Content: Arrived by taxi from the airport to find our booking had been cancelled as the payment had not been received from the booking agent. This amazed me as i had spoken to reseverations at the hotel the day before we left the uk who had indiciated there were no problems. We then spent the next hour - this was at 3am in the morning - phoning the booking agent called Jacob to determine why the payment for our room had not been made. We ended up spending £20 on calls before it was resolved and were waiting in reception for 3 hours. Finally we were shown to our room. The room slept 3 and was adequate. The 3rd bed was not as comfortable as the others. When the room was serviced they seemed to forget there were 3 of us and would leave towels for only 2 people. The bathroom had no window nor was there any form of ventilation and it got very misty and unpleasent when we showered and used the toilet. Roof top pool and sauna are enjoyable The conceirage was helpfull but we made the mistake of booking the desert safari at the hotel which was more expensive. Taxis are very hard to get late in the evening back to hotel. Now the good news. Breakfast was plentiful and varied to suit all tastes but if you leave it till the last minute to have breakfast it was very busy and the waiters were unable to attend to everyone. Deira Shopping Mall is 15 min from hotel. It is huge so allow at least half a day to go round the place and it's not expensive but Emirates Mall is just full of designer shops and unless you have unlimited funds then give it a miss. Plenty of places to eat outside the hotel which are reasonably priced. Gold souk is overwelming and you need lots of time if you want to haggle and get a reasonable bargain. The gold shops in Mina Bazaar were best and i made a few purchases here. We went on the curtousey bus to the sister hotel at the beach which was a very pleasent day. Desert Safari is a must. When you get there you can pay to go on the sand buggies but haggle the price as we witnessed an American being charged twice what we had been. It's a case of what can they get away with. Jameria Park Beach is a pleasant day out for families. If you are leaving your luggage at the hotel till your flight later in the day the make sure they do store it in the locked store room as ours was left in the lobby all day and could have gone missing. Overall , a pleasant stay but would stay in a more central location for easy access to all the attractions. Dubai is a excellent holiday location.

Reviews.Title: “Appreciated”
Reviews.Author: newageindia
Reviews.Content: This is a decently priced 5 star hotel with a good breakfast and good location. Staying for 2 nights costed me close to 300 dollars. Talking about the rooms, my room was over the construction site and i could hear the noise of tools, machines and someone pelting small stones against glass window which made early morning sleep a bit of problem. Bathrooms are not upto 5 star mark with tile pieces joint by adhesives, tubs have stains. This problem was not severe that could affect my decision. I have observed these non conformities with other 5 star hotels as well. Overall i would stay here again hopefully if construction is over.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Staff”
Reviews.Author: science321
Reviews.Content: My experience at the Coral Deira Dubai was very bad! This supposed 5* hotel, has probably the worst staff you can ever find. At my arrival, I specifically asked for a non smoking room.... guess what, I spent all my stay in a smoking room regardless of the complaints I made to management. The staff was horrible as in one of the days during my stay, they did not even made my bed! All this, not to mention the adventure it is to book a taxi! I opted to book taxis on my own through the Dubai Taxis number as the hotel staff would not ask for taxis!! Unbelievable!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the service”
Reviews.Author: knhegde
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel. The service at the reception is excellent. Breakfast is adequate. Very clean and neat rooms. The staff is friendly and efficient. Taxis are easy to get and close proximity to shopping areas. Would certainly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “without an answer after 3 E-mails from HOTEL CORAL DEIRA DUBAI !!!!”
Reviews.Author: bobolokeren
Reviews.Content: I wrote a mail for reservation and booking (with their bookingsform on their own HOTEL INTERNETWEBSITE on the 8TH of January 2008 TO THE HOTEL (Coral Deira in DUBAI) FOR 1 ROOM (5 NIGHTS from the 26th of JANUARY till the 31th of JANUARY ); According to there website , there where still rooms available . After making my choice I booked the room, together with my VISA cardnumber etc.... On that first mail : NO REPLY from the hotel; I wrote a SECOND mail : no REPLY from the hotel i wrote a THIRD mail : AGAIN : NO ANSWER FROM THE HOTEL After more than 1 week of no reply from the hotel (on the 17TH of JANUARY 2008), I PHONED TO THE HOTEL.....from BELGIUM. The reservation desk said : We are already more than ONE MONTH fully booked ..... we even dont bother to look at OUR WEBSITE to see IF people are trying to make a reservation ..... since for that period it is already OVERBOOKED !!!! Anyway, sorry for not answering your e-mail. I said to that person : Is this ARABIC policy and hospitallity ..... ? His answer : NO TIME ..... I must say..I have never had such A BAD experience when booking HOTELS, and I do book a lot of HOTELS for our COMPANY. THIS IS A 5 STAR HOTEL !!!! INCREDIBLE, SHAMEFUL.....maybe with a 2 star hotel it can happen (although ..... )

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: akisAthens
Reviews.Content: The hotel is place in a nice and convenient position, very close to everything in dubai. Finding a hotel is very easy, hotel staff is very friendly. Rooms are clean and convenient, breakfast ok. It is not exactly a 5 star hotel, but a very good 4 star one. Excellent value for the price. I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “friendly”
Reviews.Author: nomadhobart
Reviews.Content: my stay here was very pleasant. I was on my own, very nervous, and a first time visitor to Dubai, the staff were very friendly, and put me at ease straight away. They were very helpful, nothing was too much trouble, they helped me arrange tours, cabs and gave me instructions as to how to get to the places I wanted to see. The pool was very nice and most of the time i had it to myself. Breakfast was really nice, it was a nice way to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “Core Hell Dearer”
Reviews.Author: Maurice_Hall
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived at the hotel after a flight from Nairobi - making it there after midnight. Upon presenting our online prepaid accommodation voucher, we were told there was no record of us. The guy on reception made some enquiries, couldn't sort it out and so said we would need to pre-authorise to pay the 1000 Dirham a standard room cost. Fair enough - even though this was the last thing you need at that time of night - he assured us all would be sorted out in the morning. Next day, I went down to the lobby and explained to one of the staff what had happened - they informed me that the local agent had not received the booking. I then showed the hotel the confirmation emails AND my credit card online receipt to show how I had already paid for the room. Enter Mr helpful - possibly named Imad, although he didn't introduce himself. He checked the emails and credit card statements over and over and then finally phoned the company - I was asked to speak to them. They told me the mistake was the hotel's and that they would sort it out. To cut a long story short, let's just say that at 4:30 I had had enough. Almost 4 hours later I was left with no other option but to forcefully and loudly articulate my dissatisfaction at the front desk. Enter someone with customer service training. A Sri Lankan man with impeccable manners and understanding. He immediately offered us complimentary food and drinks in the restaurant (which incidentally suffered from the same lack of training - staff bringing out fried eggs instead of Caesar salad and bringing out ice-cream desert at the same time as the main course!). He also sorted out our transport to the airport and this was much appreciated - 45 minutes later he had the whole matter sorted. As for the tall black gentleman (Imad) - he was more concerned with letting us know that it was the travel agency who had made the mistake - not the hotel. He didn't seem to realise that when you have one day in Dubai, you don't want to spend it in endless arguments at the front desk. Even though the problem may not have been the hotel's fault, the way it was handled was atrocious and it ruined the last day of our holiday. The hotel (material) is fine, it's the total lack of customer care shown by some staff that lets it down a bagful. If you want to stay somewhere that you can be sure of quality service, this is not the place. Did someone say 5 star? That has to be a joke.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: WeLoveItaly
Reviews.Content: The Coral Deira is a great hotel in a safe and easy to use area in Deira. Its quite close to the airport and the taxi transfer was about 25 UAE Dirhams. Nice grreting on arrival, an ice cold fruit drink (needed) and friendly helpful staff, dont forget to offer a small tip to get the very best service! Good size rooms, very, very clean hotel in all aspects. The pool is just the right size although I found the adjacent jacuzzi too hot but in August the temperatures are close to the 50s! Sun for most of the day on the roof and with the pool being open until midnight and the evenings being so humid its a good place to be and chill out. I didnt eat here apart from breakfast which was more than adequate with a lot of choice for all visitors. Instead I chose to explore the safe friendly streets and eat Lebanese of which there is plenty of choice! I will certainly stay here on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Really Good”
Reviews.Author: gtripping
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in one of the Club Rooms. The room was very large, very clean and seemed very new. The bed was huge, never been in one that big. Service was superb with a genuine smile. Breakfast was good. Swimming pool available on the roof, never too busy, nothing fancy. Quite close to airport but windows keep out most of the noise. Nice street. Good location for the Old Souk and river, a little far to the main beach but taxis are cheap. They have a sister hotel with a fantastic private beach that is worth going to with their free shuttle bus every morning which takes you back in the afternoon. Good value, would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “An Expensive 3 star at best”
Reviews.Author: WW_Hotel_Reviewer
Reviews.Content: Folks, even in the most basic hotels in US you get water straight out of the tap and dont have to pay for it. Well not in this so called 5* Hotel. Plus there is no ironing board available. I stayed for a week and could not find a person on the staff who could tell me how to call a local cell phone. If you have guests visiting you, be ware, ask them to bring their passport or other photo ID. Guests are not allowed in your room. Specially if they are of opposite gender. There are two restaurants. An Indian and an all in one. Food was average at best. Transportation to and from hotel a bit risky. Please confirm and reconfirm the day before arrival and departure. Although I had booked the room with early arrival and paid for it the room was not ready and got charged anyway for full day for getting the room just 2 hours early. Ok now the pluses. There are two Shopping centers nearby within walking distance but be prepared for a price shock. No bargains there. There is a small Grocery Store right next to the Hotel ( Right had side if facing the hotel ) from which you can buy water. YES Hotel will not provide water even at a resonable price. I dont understand the comment that others have about convinient location. Convinient for what exactly. Going to 2 malls? Things are close to everything. Dubai is no Texas. its about the size of Rhode island at best. Things cant be very far in such a tiny place. But be prepared for long delays caused by trafic. To travel about 7 KM, or lets say 5 miles to where the business district is took about an hour in the middle of the day . So if you are going on a business trip find a location near your meeting place. Another thing about this 5* hotel. No free internet access. Oh yes the Business center has 2 machines. IF you take your lap top have a Flash memory stick and may be you will get lucky in them being able to print anything for you. As for the staff, over all good but ver few folk swith good command on English. Had to explain things several times. to get it right. If I had to compare to US based hotels / motel. I would say it was more like a Days inn or similar hotel. Generally clean, but carpets on my floor were very dirty and room next to me was being repared so had constant noise. If you use half of the Shampoo...guess what...you will be using the other half the next day. I will try a different hotel located nearby, Holiday inn, with equally clean room and better rates. or others located in Business District on Sheikh Zayed Road.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: El_Greenholio
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through the Emirates Dubai stopover service. Picked up from the airport no worries and check in was a breeze. The room was very nice. The bed was spacious and the bathroom very large. Breakfast each morning was scrumptious and aided by the attentive but unobtrusive staff. Room service was also prompt and delicious. The hotel is a bit away from the action area in Jumeirah but taxis are abundant and relatively inexpensive. Overall a comfortable, relaxing hotel to base yourself from in Dubai at a very attractive price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service good value”
Reviews.Author: neil02
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in February and agree with previous reviewers that the service here is outstanding. Staff are attentive but not intrusive. We used the rooftop pool a lot and used the excellent room service to eat up there. We were surprised how cheap the room service bill was at the end of the week. The lack of alcohol was no problem. The Holiday Express is across the road ( too smoky and downmarket) or go round the block to the Radisson etc. We took in some duty frees from the airport and had our own minibar. The food was good (beef "bacon" for understandable reasons) and meals out along the street next to the hotel were big good and cheap. We liked staying in town rather than on the beach, walking to the shops in the port area was more fun than the Malls. Coral Deira is a little jewel. I don't know why I'm telling you about it. I should keep it to myself!

Reviews.Title: “Such a friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: wendywork
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 1 week stay in Dubai, with family for the first 4 days and at the Coral Deira for 3 days. I was a little worried when we first arrived at the hotel, as we had driven from the very clean & modern Jumeirah Beach via the tunnel under the creek and the slightly 'scruffy' port area. However, once inside the hotel we were very impressed with the friendliness of all the staff, even being given a drink on our arrival ! We were a little shocked to discover that the hotel was non -alcoholic, but once we had accustomed ourselves to the idea, it did not worry us. Everywhere was clean and bright and the room was excellent. The pool on the roof was also very good and not at all crowded. It was very convenient to the creek and managed to retain all the atmosphere of city. We booked 2 excursions, one to the desert and the moonlight dinner cruise, both excellent value although the puctuality of pickup was a bit dodgy! When we go back to Dubai, we will definitely book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Above my expectations and pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Mairaone
Reviews.Content: I booked Coral Deira tentatively through the hotel website after a futile search for a hotel for my honeymoon. Given that it was 'the exhibition week', i failed to find my usual Crowne Plaza hotel at the price I normally used to pay, infact the price was three times that of the non busy season. Anyhow, I searched and found the Coral deira. For £400, not only did it include breakfast, but it was also the cheapest 5 star hotel I could find during the time, and much cheaper than Crowne Plaza etc in the non peak season! When I arrived at the hotel, I was pleasantly surprised, we were straightaway offered lemonade and within 10 minutes were shown to the room. The room was spacious, clean and well equiped. The quality of and variety of the breakfast was good. Overall, I was very impressed! Not only that, it also has a small pool which is not very busy, hence you can enjoy a quiet swim. The location was great, walking distance to Rigga road, with shops nearby to buy the cheap bottles of water etc. I would say that my stay was very pleasant, with no problems whatsoever, with really attentive and polite service. I would definitely stay in this hotel again. Although the reviews mention that it is not a 5 star hotel, the service is far above and exceeds those which I have experienced in the 5 star hotels of Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: tamster15
Reviews.Content: i just finished my stay at this hotel and booked it having read the advice on this sight. i was very pleased with the location of the hotel as we were smack bang in the middle between the souks and the deira city mall...pretty much a 10dhs cab ride (3 aud) to get to either. the staff were lovely (especially jeff ) as they booked our lunch at the burj al arab and also the desert safari. our car ride back to the apt was thrown in for free. breakfast was included and a good way to start the day with lots of fresh food. the room was very comfy and roomy (having just come from paris it was huge!!) all was very clean and well maintained..had a small gym and roof top pool...we walked (2 girls) at night to go to dinner and was very safe...be sure to check out the arabian restaurant just a few doors down...(off the top of my head its called bashwan..but try the hubbly bubbly and local food..they took great care of us..)

HotelInfo.Name: Coral Deira Dubai
HotelInfo.Address: Al Muraqabat Street | PO Box 82999, Deira, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
